page.title: 11THE DROVERS INN SHAWHEAD
page.content: In our block there is a house called Hillhead. A lady called Mrs Mary Murray lives in it. Before 1801 the house was called Mosscroft. It was built in 1611, and carved on a stone in the house are the letters I.McL. which we think may have been the initials of the builder. Mosscroft was an inn which drovers went to while waiting for their oats to be ground at the mill. The mill is now a farm called Longbeoch. The drovers drank whisky which was made from water from a dam further down the road. It was and still is illegal to make whisky without a licence. There is a piece of land near the house which is very difficult to plough. The farmers think this was the old road to the inn.
